text: Janice Lenore "Jan" Meyers (n√©e Crilly; July 20, 1928 - June 21, 2019) was an American politician. She was born in Lincoln, Nebraska. She was a former member of the United States House of Representatives from Kansas serving from 1985 to 1997.Kansapedia-Kansas Historical Society == Career == From 1972 until 1984, she was a member of the Kansas Senate. In 1978, she ran for the United States Senate, but was defeated in a multi-candidate Republican primary which was won by Nancy Kassebaum. == Personal life == Meyers died on June 21, 2019 in Merriam, Kansas from problems caused by heart disease at the age of 90. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2019 deaths Category:United States representatives from Kansas Category:Politicians from Nebraska Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:People from Lincoln, Nebraska Category:Kansas Republicans Category:Disease-related deaths in Kansas Category:Deaths from heart disease
title: Jan Meyers
